fields.description: Dear,We have created some custom Object Types in Jira Insight. These custom types are needed to store specific customer asset data. This works as designed when filling in manually.We also want to use Insight Discovery with some custom patterns to perform an automated inventory. These custom patterns should respond with our specific custom Types.However, in documentation, the pattern types can only be the defined / provided types by Riadahttps://documentation.riada.io/insight-discovery/latest/discovery-documentation/set-up-discovery/patterns#Patterns-PatternTypesHow can we return custom Pattern types from the Discovery?Thank you for the fast response.Best regards,Jens

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In any Service Desk project, removing the issue type (of the currently configured email channel) from the project causes the Project Settings -> Email requests page to fail to render properly. The heading and description is displayed, but there are no configuration options to modify the project's email channel. Furthermore, there is no indication of the root cause of the problem in either the UI or the application logs.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Service Desk project (any type)
 # Browse to Project Settings -> Email requests page and note the options to configure an email channel render correctly
 # Configure an email channel and note the Request Type being configured
 # Browse to Project Settings -> Request types and note the issue type of the request type in your email channel config
 # Browse to Project Settings -> Issue type -> click Actions -> Edit issue types -> drag the issue type from above into 'Available Issue Types' column -> click Save
 # Browse back to Project Settings -> Email requests page and note the lack of any configuration options

h3. Expected Results
 # Should still be able to configure email channel against a request type based on another available issue type. 
 # Some sort of error in the UI or log which points in the direction of a missing issue type.

!email_request_working.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Blank configuration page with no indication of what the problem is.
 !email_request_broken.png|thumbnail!

See the following error in the Console log under Developer Tools:
{code}batch.js?locale=en-US:8 Uncaught TypeError: e.join is not a function
    at d._getNiceWarningMessage (batch.js?locale=en-US:8)
    at d._getWarningMessages (batch.js?locale=en-US:8)
    at d._renderWarningMessageIfAny (batch.js?locale=en-US:8)
    at d._handleReloadView (batch.js?locale=en-US:8)
    at d.render (batch.js?locale=en-US:8)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js?locale=en-US:35)
    at c (batch.js?locale=en-US:44)
    at Object.fireWith [as resolveWith] (batch.js?locale=en-US:44)
    at u (batch.js?locale=en-US:44)
    at XMLHttpRequest.<anonymous> (batch.js?locale=en-US:44){code}
h3. Workaround

# Re-add the issue type to the 'Issue Types for Current Scheme' column.
# Sometimes adding all Issue Types to the scheme doesn't resolve the problem.  It may be possible that there is some stale email channel data somewhere that is still breaking this page.  Check under the JIRA Administration (cog icon) -> Applications tab -> Email requests page -> Scroll to the bottom and delete any entry in the 'Email addresses' section that correspond to the project you're trying to configure an email channel for.
fields.summary: Removing issue type of configured email channel breaks 'Email request' page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a Schema Manager for an object schema, the users should be able to add users and groups to the schema. Currently the schema managers are able to update only groups and when they try to add users, just by typing any letter will throw an error in thr GUI (screenshot shared in steps). Also we see 403 errors in the browser developer logs.

A similar bug was reported and resolved in 8.5 version of Insight according to a comment in [ICS-820|https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-820] which is closed but no fix version is listed. So this needs to be fixed and schema managers should have option to add users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Data Center with single node with version *(Jira 8.15.0, Insight 9.0.2)*.
 # Create a user account and a test object schema in insights.
 # Added created user as Object schema manager.
 # Add the groups in options under "*object schema configuration - roles*" and update, this works without any issues.
 # Now try to add users, we get error immediately as we try to type any letter in the GUI as shown in the screenshot listed in the attachment.
# The developer logs show 403 error:
{code:java}
{"errorMessages":["Sorry, you do not have permission to perform this action.. PermissionInsightException: User JIRAUSER15700 didn't have correct permission (admin)."],"errors":{}}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Object schema managers should be able to add the users to specific roles.
h3. Actual Results

Object schema managers are not able to add the users to specific roles.
h3. Workaround

If the object schema manager should be upgraded to Insight administrator role, or the operation should be handled by users with Insight admin privileges.
fields.summary: Object Schema Manager cannot Save changes to Object Role

So while importing blue cards from a "blue cards only" CSV file I would like to set always "blue" in the "color" attribute of my generic objects cards, but "blue" is not written in a column of the CSV I want to set this on import level.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: With the new ability to reference object across Schemas I find myself with a whole new option for organization that was not there before, and in turn allows us to now design our schemas how we originally wanted to.  The problem we have is there is no apparent way to move an object or entire object type from one schema to another with out an export and then reimport. Out problem there is that all the references to that object in current issues would not update with an export import. leaving broken links in issues. The ability to move the objects and keep current issues pointing to the object would be greatly helpful in utilizing the new cross schema reference functionality.
fields.summary: Ability to Move Objects or an Entire Object Type from One Schema to Another

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Good morning mindville,I would like to request a feature, which I haven't found in the IQL Documentation so far. It would be great to have, similar to the connectedTickets() function, a function to find objects with attachments. Please see the following example for clarification:{code:java}object HAVING attachments()object NOT HAVING attachments(){code}This feature would already help a great deal. If it's not too complex to implement, an ever greater benefit would be additional qualification options for the attachment content. Nothing extraordinary. Just some data insight seems to store anyway.{code:java}object having attachments("File name" like "test_picture.jpg")object having attachments(Created >= now(-1h)){code}Please note that the second part of the proposed feature is entirely optional. Having a general option to find just objects with or without attachment, would already improve the benefits of IQL, for our usecase, greatly!Thank you for considering this feature.
fields.summary: Attachments as IQL property

fields.description: Hello, I'm using the Insight APIs in a private tool. While developing the project, I came accross two possible features for the "Find Objects" API:1- I think there should be a way to shrink the payload, by deleting fields like objectTypeAttributes and give a chance to choose what attributes receive in all the queries.2- A way to print automatically the inbound references without the need of two queries and a merge of the data.I think it's common to use Inbound References and given the fact that Insight is an Asset Management, it's also common to write tools that communicate with it. Please consider these suggestions.
fields.summary: Inbound References and better JSON for /rest/insight/1.0/iql/objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Based on this service request: https://portal.riada.se/servicedesk/customer/portal/12/RPS-6882*Background:*We have a bunch of modems in our warehouse which periodically get shipped to different places. In Insight, the modems have 'serial number' and 'location' attributes. Our shipping guy would like to be able to scan the modems he wants to ship (the barcode returns the serial number,) then update their location attributes in a batch operation. To accomplish this, he selects the Search Filter box, scans the barcode, and the search returns the object matching the serial number (12345) as well as an option to search for a string containing the serial number (...12345...) - he then clicks the appropriate check box to add the object to the search. Doing this a couple times is no big deal but sometimes he has to scan and ship hundreds of items, and the time spent mousing around adds up.*The Request:*"If only you could scan something, and *if* there was an exact match, hitting enter would add it to the filter and clear the input field for the next scan." That way, he feels, he could scan things into the search filter as quickly as he did with his old excel spreadsheet, then use a batch operation to set the new location for the scanned items.Do you think you might add that as a feature? Can you suggest any other ways of rapidly entering data into the Search Filter via a barcode scanner? At the moment, for really big shipments, he just makes a one-off excel spreadsheet and I import it for him.Thanks for your time and consideration!
fields.summary: Rapid text input on search filter

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Insight Object schema import (Insight-Insight) is configured by wizard. It fills selector field with simply object type name and id (take look at the attached screenshot). The selector doesn't have any filter to be applied on import source (source Insight).At the moment the IQL filter may be specified in the "Filter data source by IQL" field below actually applied on destination side (destination Insight).Such import turns out very inefficient in the case when contains thousands of objects, but only few should be imported to the destination...Please extend the import selector :)
fields.summary: Insight - Insight import: selector with condition "objectType;id[condition]"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Dear Riada/Mindville team, I'd like to put in a feature request to expand the reporting capabilities to include generating reports across: # Multiple Object Schemas # Multiple Object TypesI'd like to be able to run a report that can combine hardware data that's located in one object schema and employee data that located in a separate object schema. I'd also like the ability to run a report within one object schema across different object types, not just one type of object. Currently, this is not possible with the available out-of-the-box reports. In addition, the create your own report example and instructions do not cover this scenario and there is no current instructions on how to do this. While the current available reports were made to cover general use cases, it seems that Insight's ability to have multiple object schemas and multiple object types would lend itself to having this type of reporting capability right from the start. In other words, I think these types of reports should fall under the general use case and should be made available out-of-the-box.That being said, please make this functionality available. It would be extremely helpful for our team.Thank you in advance. Best regards,Joseph
fields.summary: Reports for multiple object types and multiples object schemas

Customers is only aloowed to see their assets, hence we add their customer portal login to the objects they are allowed to pick. The feature request is to make it possible to add an organization as an attribute directly. So that all users belongin to that organizations can view the insight object.BR,Viktor

fields.description: Microsofts Active Directory uses two different formats to store dates.Currently these values are imported as plain text, which especially for the second format (see below) sadly does not help at all.It would be really helpful if Insight converted these values to readable datetimes automatically.*Generalized Time*example: 20180705131341.0Zresult: 05.07.2018 15:13:41example fields: whenChanged, whenCreated*Microsoft OID for Time*example: 131799092312363246result: 28.08.2018 07:53:51example fields: lastLogon, badPasswordTime, pwdLastSet
fields.summary: LDAP import: parse datetime values correctly

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The objectFacade.storeCommentBean() does not respect either the current user or the setAuthor() method of CommentBean.{code:java}CommentBean newComment = new CommentBean\(\)        newComment.setComment\("Some text"\)        newComment.setRole(CommentBean.ACCESS_LEVEL_USERS\)        log.error\("CURRENT USER:" \+ authContext.loggedInUser.key \+ " "  \+ authContext.loggedInUser\)        newComment.setAuthor(authContext.loggedInUser.key\)        log.error\("COMMENT AUTHOR:" \+ newComment.author\)        newComment.setObjectId(getObjectBean(object\).id\)        newComment = objectFacade.storeCommentBean(newComment\)       log.error\("NEW COMMENT AUTHOR:" \+ newComment.author\){code}The output from this:{code:java}2021-01-06 17:21:35,843+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-17 ERROR schemaManager@stuxnet.se 1041x5227x1 vu6hsd 192.168.50.104,127.0.0.1 /rest/scriptrunner/latest/user/exec/ \[customRiadaLibraries.insightmanager.InsightManagerForScriptrunner] CURRENT USER:JIRAUSER10301 schemaManager@stuxnet.se(JIRAUSER10301\)2021-01-06 17:21:35,843+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-17 ERROR schemaManager@stuxnet.se 1041x5227x1 vu6hsd 192.168.50.104,127.0.0.1 /rest/scriptrunner/latest/user/exec/ \[customRiadaLibraries.insightmanager.InsightManagerForScriptrunner] COMMENT AUTHOR:JIRAUSER103012021-01-06 17:21:35,870+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-17 ERROR anders 1041x5227x1 vu6hsd 192.168.50.104,127.0.0.1 /rest/scriptrunner/latest/user/exec/ \[customRiadaLibraries.insightmanager.InsightManagerForScriptrunner] NEW COMMENT AUTHOR:JIRAUSER10000{code}Looks like the problem is here, it uses the wrong author. com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.core.ObjectServiceImpl#storeCommenth3. SuggestionAfter discussing with the devs. it turns out that the comment will be always submitted by the Logged in user, so setting up the Author will always be overridden by the User in context...However the fact that there is a method available for setAuthor() is confusing for the users. Hence this method should be removed if it does not serve any purpose.
fields.summary: The objectFacade.storeCommentBean() does not respect the author value

fields.description: I have some accounts about the quantity of goods, and I need to increase or reduce the quantity of my goods through workflow.These quantities are random in each workflow.and cannot be set to default.Change value:  Specify the change value. Anything except a number will be set to default (1) .It does not support "place holders" ，like "$\{customfield_10328} ".Because integer cannot be set as labels, i cannot use other plug-ins to extract numeric properties and perform calculations.I have 2 CustomField：CustomField 10328 is a standard number fieldCustomField 10321 Mapping to insight objectType 100objectTypeAttribute 1004 of insight objectType 100, type=defailt ,type value=integerI need Update object attribute 1004 with the value “attribute 1004” Minus “CustomField 10328”I have no experience. I tried to modify Groovy script examples"Update object attribute", but I haven't touched on subtraction yet. I made an error.*class com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.common.exception.GroovyInsightException*GroovyInsightException: No signature of method: com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.model.factory.ObjectAttributeBeanFactory.createObjectAttributeBeanForObject() is applicable for argument types: (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.model.ObjectBean, com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.model.ObjectTypeAttributeBean, java.lang.Double) values: [CGO52_ESFP-GE-SX-MM1310_H3C_TEST (NW-737281), ObjectTypeAttributeBean [id=1004, name=StockValue, type=DEFAULT], ...] Possible solutions: createObjectAttributeBeanForObject(com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.model.ObjectBean, com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.model.ObjectTypeAttributeBean, [Ljava.lang.String;), createObjectAttributeBeanForObject(com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.model.ObjectBean, com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.model.ObjectTypeAttributeBean, java.text.DateFormat, java.text.DateFormat, [Ljava.lang.String;)'Please help me!Best Regards
fields.summary: "place holders" are supported in “Increase or decrease the value of an object attribute”

fields.description: Hello Team,Could you please add a feature where in an Import configuration I can set a field to NULL. Concretely I need to be able to remove any outbound references when an Object is missing.Example: * Object "Application" has an Insight Object Attribute "Databases" (1:n). * When I Import a CSV containing the links between Applications and Databases, the file contains only Applications that have a connection to a database. * Application-ABC has a connection to Database-123 * Now I remove this link record from the CSV and reimport it. Under current circumstances, the link remains in Insight, even though it is not present in the source feed anymore * What would be great is if through the "Update" function in the import configuration, the Insight Object Field "Database" can be set to NULL or EMPTY, to remove the connection between the objects.The feature could be as simple as a little check-box "Set Field as Empty" in the Import Configuration.Let me know if you need any clarification. I will try to upload some sample data a little later.Cheers & thx,Andreas
fields.summary: Remove outbound references through NULL Value

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: From a customer:On our environment we have node1, node2, node4... The node4 is dedicated to complete technical tasks and is not available for the proper GUI usage due to problems to submit forms with the current load balancer implemenation. It would be nice to have an option to choose the node in Insight re-indexing page: * to initiate the indexing (clean, simple) * persist the indexAlso, an option in the UI, to share the index among the nodes: !image-2020-05-06-12-59-48-091.png|width=1023,height=402!
fields.summary: Data Center Indexing improvements

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: To be able to use Insight efficiently together with Jira, you need to go through the Custom field configuration page for Insight Object/s fields. Today this is really a challenge, especially for a non experienced Insight user, but even after having used Insight 3 years it is difficult. The UI needs major updates. Here is a few examples:h3. Naming and description of the configurationsWhat do the different setting really configure?What is the difference between "Filter Scope (IQL)", "Filter issue scope (IQL)", "Filter Assign Scope" and "Make Filter Assign Strict" ? This needs to be more clearly described - labels need to be easier to understand and help texts available on the screen. Help texts today are not really helpful. See also how hover and click combination on info-sign looks in screenshot.h3. Filter Scope (IQL)User needs to be familiar with IQL to be able to use an Insight custom field. This is a HUGE obstacle, especially as you don't get any autocomplete.In 98% of the cases you want a custom field to show objects from one object type. Please add a select box for the object type as a "Basic configuration" - IQL may still be needed of course in an Advanced configurations view.With this simple improvement, any user will be able to start using Insight fields in a minute!h3. Filter issue scope (IQL)The fantastic use of placeholders to create filtered views is almost impossible to use. I understand it may be difficult to add "click and play" configurations for all possible alternatives, but an easy solution would be an "Add snippet IQL" functionality for the most common use cases like: * Reference to another custom field on the issue.  * Limit objects depending on attributes containing the currentUser/reporter/assigneeAlso, please enable autocomplete in the IQL box. h3. Filter assign scope As above, at least add snippet examples of common use cases.
fields.summary: Custom field configuration needs major improvements

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In many cases the setup is depending on scheduled imports from other systems running every night. However, if the import is failing by some reason, you will today need to get in and look on the process result each day. As you don't know it is failing this won't happen. To make sure to catch such import errors, it would be really good to be able to setup a user or several users to be notified when an import is failing.
fields.summary: Alert functionality for failing imports

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When selecting from a drop down it is showing the first 25 objects matching what I have typed. In attached picture all that contains P. !No match in the first 25 in drop down.png!In my case we have an object named only P. But I can not reach it since it is not among the 25 showed. And I can not continue typing since it is named only P.Suggestion to have some way for doing exact search when selecting in the drop down. Or to have a more advanced way of selecting as I have seen in Jira tickets:!Selection pop-up in Jira tickets.png!Originally discussed in [https://portal.mindville.com/plugins/servlet/desk/portal/12/RPS-15639].
fields.summary: Select in drop down list based on strictly equal or advanced selection pop-up

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently all object attributes are static, either a link to another object type or has a plain text / selected field option.Desired is to have scripted attributes, where either data from an external source could be retrieved from, or to be able to do calculations. Our use case;Customer has an SLA with their customer that application X is allowed to be down for X minutes per period. If it's more than this amount, penalties apply. We want to use Insight to keep track of the total available minutes and the remaining minutes, in real time.
fields.summary: Scripted (groovy) attribute

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Right now the Object View screen has two options: Detail View, List View. If an object has subgroups, and the subgroups have their own subgroups, the user will have to use the graph view to do some selections to see the group tree.Viewing things in hierarchy is a very common need. Most users are not familiar with using the graph view.Suggestion:Add a simple tree view screen to the object view options, to allow an end user to see multiple layers of subgrouping, under a user selected relationship, in a view.Example:reference selected: "includes Organizations"Organization 1---SubOrg 1------SubSubOrg 1------SubsubOrg 2---SubOrg 2------SubSubOrg 1------SubsubOrg 3
fields.summary: Add a Tree View to the Object View Screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: An often needed report type is a report that allows a user to select two or more related object types, and to choose attributes under each object type, and generate a composite report.Ideally, this report can be set up, saved, exported, and shared with other users, by a user.At minimal, the Insight admin/manager should be able to set up the report and allow a user to select, generate, and export.Right now, it seems only a programmer with Insight/jira admin right can create such reports through coding.It will be even better if such multiple type viewing is provided through a composite view screen, rather then a report output.
fields.summary: Multiple Type Report

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The free text search box on the top blue bar is very useful for end users who don't know IQL and don't know where, what to search. But the result may be too much for a user to sort through unless the user has deeper knowledge.It will be nice to give this free text search box an object type selector, so a user can choose a few types to limit the search.

I would be good to have the possibility to use all available attributes of an object with custom field variables.

fields.description: I am unable to figure out how to add multiple objects to a single attribute in groovy.What is the append equivalent for this?try { objectTypeAttributeBean = objectFacade.storeObjectAttributeBean(newObjectAttributeBean);} catch (Exception vie) { log.warn("Could not update object attribute due to validation exception:" + vie.getMessage());}Apologies if I am missing something here.  Using the REST API, we were able to something like this:for i in insight_key: insight_key_d={} insight_key_d['key'] = i payload['update']['customfield_{}'.format(field)][0]['add'].append(insight_key_d)

fields.description: When keeping classes in different files and executing them in the Insight console they get errors. We believe that when a script imports custom classes it doesnt seem to work. When trying these two custom classes and run them separetly instead of keeping them in the same file, it did not work:For insight-check-b2b-customers.groovy*class com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.common.exception.GroovyInsightException*GroovyInsightException: startup failed: Script1.groovy: 8: unable to resolve class com.jirahelpers.InsightObjectsUtils @ line 8, column 1. import com.jirahelpers.InsightObjectsUtils ^ 1 error 'For InsightObjectUtils.groovy*class com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.common.exception.GroovyInsightException*GroovyInsightException: Failed to create Script instance for class: class com.jirahelpers.InsightObjectsUtils. Reason: org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.typehandling.GroovyCastException: Cannot cast object 'com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.groovy.GroovyLogger@3bda12cd' with class 'com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.groovy.GroovyLogger' to class 'org.apache.log4j.Category''Will a developer verify what the case is with custom classes being imported and kept in different files? Does this not work? Will we support this in the future?
fields.summary: Custom classes not supported for groovy scripting?

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be very convenient and certainly would help our less technical people to consult our CMDB if Insight would allow to bundle a set of relations in some sort of "favourite" or "preset" in the graphs.Currently, when opening an object graph, very many relationships show up and selecting the correct ones for a specific view can be tedious.It would be very good if we could freely specify a depth, count and relations to display in some sort of preset that we can manage or share so that we can easily and systematically produce the same views.Example use cases : - Render an end-to-end capability-to-infrastructure view (similar to ArchiMate's layered viewpoint) - Render the "application usage viewpoint"-like graph (from business process down to application) - Render the "infrastructure usage viewpoint"We can realise these now, but they require many clicks and cross-checks in the relation list of the graph.Usability and repeatability-wise this would be a greatly-appreciated feature
fields.summary: Allow to define "presets" or "favourites" for the settings and relationships shown in the graph

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As an Insight user, I want to be able to quickly flag objects/assets to pinpoint those that need to be fixed, changed, updated, or removed, so that regular users can do such flagging in-context while doing their daily chores.Example: I'm working in Jira, doing work for a customer. While doing this, I notice that one of the Insight objects/assets has invalid data. I am not the owner of the object, nor responsible for updating or fixing it. I only want to raise the object for others to review.An example workflow that kind of works but is too inconvenient is to have "flagged" checkbox attribute on all objects. When I notice something wrong with the objects, I open the object for editing and set the flag, and then provide a quick comment to say what I think is wrong with the object. And then there is an automation that picks the flagged objects and creates Jira issues for each of them. This does work, but if you notice missing data on an object that is connected to a Jira issue (as a custom field), there is no quick shortcut to flag such object.
fields.summary: Flagging of Insight objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be nice to see a list of objects with some selected atributes in a gadget or Report.The same information you get in a list view of the objects, but placed in a Jira gadget, so you can see everything in a single Jira Dashboard.
fields.summary: List View in Report or Gadgets

fields.description: We would like to increase the quantity of data that we can import from SCCM.Our customer is using some information managed by SCCM like "Battery" and other attributes to filter the kind of computer (Servers, desktops, laptops, etc.).Can we expend the attributes that we can import?
fields.summary: Increase quantity of data that we can import from SCCM

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: IQL priority order of clauses

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Setting "Delete" in the import configuration for handling missing objects is really dangerous and may delete all objects and all the connections to existing issues' custom fields. At least if you don't know 100% how it works.*Take a look at this example (which luckily happened in our test environment):* - We have an Insight structure with a lot of objects connected to about 50000 issues. - An import is run manually each week to update objects (which works fine with "Update" option selected) - Someone wants to add a few new objects by importing them. Thus he creates a new import configuration. As he is not aware of what the options mean, he leaves option to the default option "Delete". Threshold is by default set to 1 Day. - He runs the import once and his new objects are created and everything looks fine. - Two days later we realize that all objects except the new ones are deleted as the import as passed the threshold of 1 day. As the import is automatically set to autosync it has run every night since.The effect of this is that we would need to reimport all objects and the objects referring to the deleted ones, bulk change all issues to point to the new object keys. And not to mention all filters querying on the old object keys. Glad this was in test :)*Proposed solution:* # This problem would be avoided if "Ignore" was set as the default value as this will not destroy anything. An unexperienced user would probably think twice before changing to Delete. # Uncheck the "automatic synchronise" as this might result in passing the threshold without knowing. And as well - as all imports have the same default cron expression, it might hit hard on performance when lots of jobs start at the same time.Easy solution to implement which is needed - especially now that we will have many new unexperienced users in Insight.
fields.summary: Set "Ignore" as default for Delete missing objects in import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h3. Problem DefinitionCurrently, if a user is trying to merge 2 Jira instances, then they can use Jira Project import to import projects from one instance to another. This results into the issue keys getting changed.  After this, if they export/import Insight data into the instance, then the object keys also get changed. As a result, the instance now loses the link between objects and Jira issues.There is currently no option to restore this mapping between Jira issues and Insight objects after a restore.h3. Suggested SolutionWe need to find a solution that allows for the merging of 2 Jira instances(with Insight data) without losing the mapping between Jira issues and objects.h3. WorkaroundThe only option at this point is to edit Jira issues manually and link them to the right Insight object but it is not feasible for large instances :(
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to have the possibility to merge two Jira instances with Insight data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello, Implementation of Insight uses Issue manager to update issue not standart Issue Service with issue parameters change store. So, every change in insight postfunctions is visible in issue history as separated action after transition action. But it is not true, because change was triggered in postfunction of transition.So we need from Insight team to make standard functionality to store insight data with issue service on transition actions, with issue transition vars. Problem is also with notifications becasue if we use Isnight PF to set Assignee and we need to notificate him, it is not possible, because Insight update existing issue after create notification is sent.Clients asking us who did update issue after transition and we had to say it is in transition, but Insight update issue separately, so issue history is mess than.Side effect of this is: if we use JMWE or Script runner or Time to SLA with update issue listener, it is trigger so many times as many postfunctions of Insight is on transition.... Required function as OOB postfunctions.... Changes as part of transition actionsLinked with   GHS-209620
fields.summary: Not update issue in every post-function

fields.description: HiI am currently revamping our customer service portal, replacing a lot of our custom fields with Insight fields.However I've noticed that only custom fields are shown to the user once the ticket has been created, the Insight fields only show on the Jira ticket, this would be a nice to have as I imagine a user is going to wonder why they can't see the info they've entered, I notice when I raised my last ticket that the affected product selection was visible so perhaps I have not configured my Service Desk correctly.Please advisethanks

fields.description: Hello,I don't know if i'm missing something and maybe it is already possible.But when i use an Insight Custom field, in this case on the issue view screen, i can hover over an Asset and see all the attributes, thats great.But our customer (SURFnet) which uses Insight want's to see if there are already issues connected to this Asset when hovering over it.So when an issue / incident is reported regarding an asset, you are able to see if there are other incidents, or maybe changes pending regarding this asset.So when you open an asset you will see it in the part at the right bottom corner named 'Connected JIRA Issues'.Is this already possible in a way? Or can you please add that feature?As extra detail i've attached 2 screenshots, 1 is when hovering over this specific asset in issue view screen, we see all the attributes. The other one is the part of the Insight issue detail view, where the connected issues are shown. That part i would like to see when hovering over the asset. So in this case i would see when hovering over that issue that eg. a change/project is planned where this asset will be involved.Would like to hear from you, thanks!Kind Regards,Joost Damen
fields.summary: Option to show Connected JIRA issues when hovering over an Asset in JRIA issue view screen
